text: Walnut Grove was a small town (now extinct) in Prairie Township, Warren County, Indiana, located three miles east of Tab. A 1913 history describes the town's population as about 50. ==History== A post office was once established at Walnut Grove in 1872, and remained in operation until it was discontinued in 1900. ==Geography== Walnut Grove is located in flat, open farmland at the intersection of County Roads 650 North and 500 West. ==References== * Clifton, Thomas A. (editor) (1913), Past and Present of Fountain and Warren Counties, Indiana, Indianapolis: B. F. Bowen & Co. Category:Former populated places in Warren County, Indiana Category:Former populated places in Indiana
title: Walnut Grove, Warren County, Indiana
